properties.NAME: Mott Hall II
properties.OVERVIEW: We are dedicated to the academic and personal development of our scholars. We offer multiple opportunities for scholars to develop as leaders and to become well-rounded individuals through our various partnerships and programs. Scholars are challenged to question, anticipate, and solve problems. They take responsibility and emerge as lifelong learners and independent thinkers, motivated by the pursuit of academic excellence, cultural experience, and social responsibility.
properties.SUBWAY: 1, B, C to Cathedral Parkway-110th St

properties.NAME: Lower Manhattan Community Middle School
properties.OVERVIEW: At Lower Manhattan Community (LMC), we work to build a rich middle school experience for all of our students by combining rigorous curriculum, an intense focus on the arts, two years of foreign language, and a strong advisory and community service experience for all students. Our students participate in an enormous range of arts and after-school programs which run Monday-Friday until 5:45pm. Our students take many field trips into the community, to conduct community service, build upon our academic curriculum, and explore our city. Students also attend overnight trips during their middle school experience. LMC is located in the 26 Broadway Building on the sixth and seventh floors. In this historic building, the NYCDOE constructed brand new facilities in 2010. Classrooms are stocked with SMART Boards, laptop computers, iPads, and other technologies.

properties.NAME: City Knoll Middle School
properties.OVERVIEW: City Knoll Middle School believes that young people have the ability to become whatever they want with the right education, guidance, and support. Our community understands the interconnected world that we live in, and strives to create learning experiences for students through an approach that is in tune with their interests and strengths. We also believe that students learn best when they are provided with real world opportunities to learn through the arts and projects that are relevant to their lives. The arts, public speaking, and presentation are core features of the instructional approach and support the development of critical thinking and creativity. City Knoll has established partnerships with the Museum of Modern Art, NYC Outward Bound, Middle School Quality Initiative, Learning Partners Program, ExpandEd Extra Book Clubs, Manhattan Youth after-school program, Morgan Library Book Arts Project, and Urban Advantage. Students appreciate teachers immersing them in rigorous project-based curricula, while nurturing them to be empathetic, independent individuals capable of shaping their own futures.
properties.SUBWAY: 1, 2, 3, A, C, E to 34th St - Penn Station

properties.NAME: Central Park East II
properties.OVERVIEW: Central Park East II (CPE II) is a collaborative community where staff, parents, and students work together to create a safe, caring, academically rigorous, and joyful school environment. Our small size allows us to know each child and family well. CPE II provides an enriched education to all students. Students at CPE II receive instruction in the arts, including visual arts, music, movement, and dance. We will continue to give students the foundational skills, understandings, and habits of mind that will help them in becoming thoughtful readers, writers, mathematicians, scientists, and keen observers of the world, as well as ethical agents for change.

properties.NAME: P.S. Q004
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: I.S. 5 - The Walter Crowley Intermediate School
properties.OVERVIEW: At I.S. 5, We Talk Like Scholars, Write Like Experts, Think Like Innovators, and Live Like Leaders! Students appreciate that I.S. 5 provides them with a nurturing learning environment which is focused on developing their academic and emotional needs to prepare every student for high school and beyond. In order to foster connections between staff and students in a large middle school setting, I.S. 5 consists of four learning communities commonly referred to as Community of Scholars, Community of Experts, Community of Innovators, and Community of Leaders. Our school community is currently engaging in opportunities for project-based learning, with hands-on projects that highlight the importance of global citizenship and the legacies of our contributions in the community at large. We are continuing to build student socio- emotional growth through the incorporation of Leader in Me and a tiered approach to Next Level Readiness support through Grade Six Advisories, Grade Seven College Access for All, and Grade Eight Research and Media Studies. We pride ourselves on engaging students to build autonomous learners that will be successful members of the 21st century and communicating and celebrating student growth with our parents and families.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 008 Richard S. Grossley
properties.OVERVIEW: All students are encouraged to participate in school activities and community service as well as to develop meaningful relationships with adults in our school. Students enjoy the availability of interesting classes and after-school activities. There is an enrichment program to fit each student's needs. Parents appreciate our various methods of making the home/school connection. We communicate with parents using the school messenger system which notifies parents of school events over the TEL, emails, and mailings. In addition, we provide informational workshops for parents. Parents also enjoy our new Parent Center which is complete with computers, a color printer, and comfortable seating. Our parent coordinator and community assistants are available to demonstrate Skedula, Acuity, and Access web-based programs for families. Parents/Guardians also like our principal's open door policy, where they have an opportunity to meet with the principal, academy principals, and school staff.

properties.NAME: P.S. 009
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: I.S. 010 Horace Greeley
properties.OVERVIEW: We provide a diverse education in a supportive environment that promotes self-discipline, motivation, and excellence in learning. Our spirited atmosphere includes students wearing school uniforms daily and participating in teamwork initiatives. Our collaborations with parents and community partners help students to become self-sufficient and develop the skills needed to succeed and contribute responsibly to a global community.

properties.NAME: P.S. Q023 @ Queens Children Center
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: I.S. 025 Adrien Block
properties.OVERVIEW: Adrien Block I.S. 25 offers a variety of classes for a diverse group of learners. All classes follow the Common Core and engage students in rigorous learning, preparing them for high school and beyond. I.S. 25 immerses our students in a college- and career-readiness program. The Performing Arts Program is an integral part of our school culture. Students have the opportunity to choose from Band, Chorus, Dance, Art, and Keyboard in grade six and develop their talent during their time at I.S. 25. We offer a School Enrichment Model (SEM) which provides enriched learning experiences where students engage in learning clusters based on their strengths and interests. Some clusters include: Computer Programming, Drama, Fashion Blogger, Stock Market, Sports Marketing, and Manga Anime. STEAM projects are produced by students on each grade level. Our STEM Aviation Curriculum ties in physics, topography, meteorology, and geography while students learn the forces of flight and how they relate to weather. We partner with Greater Ridgewood Youth Council five days a week, 2:30pm-5:30pm. Activities include homework support, basketball, archery, art programs, community building, and STEM.

properties.NAME: P.S./M.S 042 R. Vernam
properties.OVERVIEW: P.S./M.S. 42 achieves academic excellence for all students by supporting their strengths and needs. Our goal is to meet the Common Core Learning Standards while creating a learning environment that will boost all students to grade level and above. We build morale by instilling in our students, staff, and parents a sense of self-respect along with an appreciation for the diversity of the multicultural society in which we live, work, and learn. As a school community, we believe that students learn best through instruction that is tailored to their specific learning styles and needs. We have invested in technology to advance the skills of our students and make them competitive in today's world. All of our classrooms are equipped with SMART Boards, and over 250 laptops, 140 iPad minis and two 3-D printers are available for students within classrooms. Our students have access to such programs as Lego robotics, Broadway Jr., Enact and more. We provide parents with up-to-date information, through Pupil Path and written correspondence, so that they can partner with the school to ensure that every child is college- and career-ready.

properties.NAME: P.S. 043
properties.OVERVIEW: The School by the Sea-P.S./M.S. 43Q is a pre-K-8 college and career preparatory public school in the Far Rockaway section of Queens, New York. Our goal is to develop children into leaders by providing them with a quality education that will prepare them for success in high school, college and beyond. The School by the Sea-P.S./M.S. 43Q will serve to meet the individual needs of our children academically and socially. Our school will provide students with a rigorous education as well as meaningful collegiate and professional connections. As a result, children will grow with the personal motivation necessary to succeed and inevitably develop into well-rounded, productive citizens.

properties.NAME: P.S. 047 Chris Galas
properties.OVERVIEW: Our school's vision is one in which the staff members, students, and parents work collaboratively in a safe and supportive environment. Learning is defined as an ongoing process that is incorporated into all aspects of the curriculum, as well as enrichment programs that link the arts and literacy. We strongly encourage our students to take risks within the safety of the classroom in order to facilitate independence and higher-order thinking skills. Our students will evolve into responsible, accountable, and self-assured adults who will establish themselves as part of the community network. Having only one class per grade level allows students to receive a lot of individual attention from our strong staff. Our middle school curriculum consists of the core subjects of humanities (ELA and social studies), math, and science. We are a Respect for All award school.

properties.NAME: P.S. 049 Dorothy Bonawit Kole
properties.OVERVIEW: At P.S./I.S. 49 we work tirelessly to create a nurturing environment that fosters lifelong learning. We offer our students a liberal arts program infused with technology and cultural arts. We encourage our students to be both independent thinkers and problem solvers. Our school program provides a dynamic environment with quality teaching and high standards of rigor and accountability. P.S./I.S. 49 has won many awards for academic achievement. The school is committed to professional development and innovation.

properties.NAME: M.S. 053 Brian Piccolo
properties.OVERVIEW: Brian Piccolo M.S. 53 is the school of choice for the new millennium. Our community school is truly a school for the 21st century that provides a state of the art Zion Cradle to Career STEM Academy (robotics and coding). Through rigorous coursework we challenge our scholars academically while providing a safe and supportive learning environment. Our family-oriented school strives to give back to our community through supports we receive from our strategic partnerships, which include but are not limited to, the Sports and Arts in School Foundation (SASF), Urban Arts, and Life Changing Music that provides a well-rounded extracurricular program for our students. Additionally, our small community school services multi-talented scholars and we pride ourselves on educating the mind, body, and soul of each scholar in preparation for entrance into high school. Our scholars have access to numerous in-school and after-school programs that are available through our partnerships which are designed to enrich and compliment their learning style and experiences. Our families appreciate both our open-door policy and our welcoming environment. Here at M.S. 53 we believe that Education Saves Lives!
properties.SUBWAY: A to Far Rockaway - Mott Ave

properties.NAME: I.S. 059 Springfield Gardens
properties.OVERVIEW: I.S. 59 scholars are engaged in project-based and hands-on inquiry based learning to deepen their level of understanding while developing socially acceptable behaviors to develop into independent leaders and productive members of the global community. Scholars are afforded the opportunity to engage in Urban Advantage Science Activities, Dance, Student Government, Drama, Chess and other academic activities. Eligible scholars have the opportunity to enroll in Specialized High School Prep classes. Our staff communicates with families via TeacherEase, SchoolCXNT and School Messenger. We partner with the YMCA to offer after-school and summer programs at no cost. Our students have the highest acceptance rate in the NYC area for the Legal Outreach Program. Selected eighth grade students participate in the school's partnership with Northwell-LIJ for extended science instruction. The Rising Star Academy for Scholars attracts families of motivated scholars who have the opportunity to participate in Regents classes in Math, Science, History, English and Spanish, with a successful 99% passing rate thus far. Our parents are actively involved in our school community. We host Summer Bridge classes for our incoming scholars.

properties.NAME: I.S. 061 Leonardo Da Vinci
properties.OVERVIEW: Students in our school are fully immersed in differentiated instruction that targets their individual learning needs. Students are able to select up to two talent activities each school year. I.S. 61 has created five academies within the main school that foster a nurturing environment for our students. Each academy is set up with its own dean, guidance counselor, assistant principal, and staff of teachers, therefore creating a small learning community. Parents are also able to track their child's progress for each unit through a special Engrade account. To support our efforts to assist students in meeting the standards for college- and career-readiness, parents have an option to select our AGP program for their child. Students are expected to maintain an 85 GPA as well as take all Regents offered by the school. Programs are also available for parents of our school community, including English as a New Language (ENL), GED, and fitness programs.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 067 Louis Pasteur
properties.OVERVIEW: Louis Pasteur Middle School 67Q is dedicated to promoting academic achievement by creating a supportive teaching and learning environment that recognizes the unique social, emotional, and intellectual needs of young adolescents. Since 1991, we have embraced the tenets of a middle school philosophy. We remain committed to providing an excellent, well-rounded education within a nurturing environment. We also are proud of the devotion and support each child can expect from our entire staff. Students have opportunities to join clubs, teams, and activities enabling them to demonstrate their talents and follow their interests. Our Student Organization sponsors community service projects and family events at Broadway shows and local sporting events. Also, our students excel in the Arts and perform for the school and surrounding community through a Drama Production and grade-level "Nights of the Arts."

properties.NAME: Catherine & Count Basie Middle School 72
properties.OVERVIEW: Our school is a community of instructional innovation that provides choices and options for young people to become critical thinkers and lifelong learners in an environment of care and respect. Our goal is to meet the need of every young person through collaboration, opportunity, and experience. Catherine and Count Basie Middle School is one of the best-kept secrets of District 28. Our school staff is committed to providing a high-quality and meaningful educational experience for each child. The school's environment supports students, parents, and staff in an effort to offer every child an opportunity for an excellent education. Our curriculum includes specialty courses, advisory courses, elective courses, and a range of extracurriculars, all within a challenging curriculum. We provide students with the opportunity to take educational excursions, visit colleges and universities, interact with political officials, and use their voices to impact change in our ever-changing society.

properties.NAME: I.S. 73 - The Frank Sansivieri Intermediate School
properties.OVERVIEW: We are a diverse school community that is divided into five small learning communities called academies. Each of these academies serves as a smaller school within our building to help create and foster a nurturing environment for the students they house. We have done this by assigning each academy its own assistant principal, dean, guidance counselor, and staff of teachers. Each academy is geographically located in a specific area of the building and has its own lunch and assembly periods. In order to provide students with an opportunity to become active members of the school community, I.S. 73's Student Council has been established to enhance school spirit and to improve the overall student experience. These students are elected to one-year positions and serve as representatives of their grade level as well as their homeroom class. Student Council members are responsible for discussing school-wide concerns and activities during the year. In addition, our school provides all eighth graders the opportunity to take the Specialized High School Exam in school during the school day at I.S. 73. Kaplan provides free test prep prior to the exam for all of our students who choose to sit for the exam.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 074 Nathaniel Hawthorne
properties.OVERVIEW: Nathaniel Hawthorne Middle School provides a nurturing environment where students from grades six through eight are empowered to explore their passions, through facilitated learning opportunities that lead to student achievement. We acknowledge that, as individuals, we all have different needs and aspirations. We collaborate with our families to ensure that a complete education is provided in order to prepare our students for high school, college, and beyond. As a "Respect for All" school, this mission is built into the fabric of our school culture and climate. We are proud to partner with the NYCDOE Urban Advantage Science Initiative, Office of Arts and Special Projects through Arts Achieve, St. Francis College, and the Jose Limon Dance Company to provide rigorous field experiences and differentiated learning opportunities that help to intellectually challenge our students. We believe that Together Everyone Achieves More, which is what makes this school a shining jewel within the community.

properties.NAME: Robert E. Peary School
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: I.S. 077
properties.OVERVIEW: I.S. 77 is a family of learners. We offer programs for special progress and honors, English as a New Language, and special education. We offer Spanish, with differentiation for native speakers. Each classroom is equipped with a laptop, a projector with a document camera, and speakers. There are opportunities for students to become involved in community outreach programs. We celebrate a Student of the Month based on virtues. We have a partnership with the Greater Ridgewood Youth Council who sponsors an after-school program which offers homework help, sports, and recreation in our school. We also work with the Youth Council in their young adult internship program which benefits many of our graduates. Our PTA is very active and encourages all parents to be a part of our family of learners. Through the use of the internet program PupilPath, parents and teachers are able to communicate with each other regarding grades and assignments. We are part of the Middle School Quality Initiative sponsored by the DOE. We receive support and training in literacy applications! Seventh grade is part of College and Careers for all. Seventh grade students travel to college campuses and attend programs related to College and Careers.
properties.SUBWAY: M to Forest Ave; L to Halsey St

properties.NAME: P.S./I.S. 78Q
properties.OVERVIEW: We focus on providing our students with a challenging and global education while meeting the emotional, creative, and social needs of all students. We focus on critical thinking and problem solving through interactive literacy and math activities, enhanced through an integration of the arts into the core curriculum. Parents are actively involved in their children's education and we share the joys of watching our children grow, learn new skills, and make friends. We implement the Renzulli Schoolwide Enrichment Model (SEM) in all grades and include parent talent, community volunteers, and experts from the community in developing an enrichment curriculum. By addressing the needs of all students, including our students with special needs, English Language Learners, and gifted students, the SEM Model engages all of the children in visual, musical, spatial, and kinesthetic activities through their interests and talents thereby enabling them to enhance their academic potential.
properties.SUBWAY: G to 21st St; 7 to Vernon Blvd-Jackson Ave

properties.NAME: Central Queens Academy Charter School
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: P.S./I.S. 087 Middle Village
properties.OVERVIEW: It is our mission to educate our children, not only academically, but through a core foundation of knowledge that includes the arts, technology, and the ability to accept individual differences as assets rather than hindrances. It is our hope that our students will recognize social injustices, speak out against inequities, and value humanity so that when they take over our society they are caring, empathetic people who will advocate for the goodness of all mankind.

properties.NAME: I.S. 093 Ridgewood
properties.OVERVIEW: In carrying out our mission to prepare all of our students for the rigors of high school, college, and 21st century careers, we offer our students opportunities to take selected Regents exams. Our curriculum and instruction in all major subject areas are aligned with the Common Core Learning Standards. Our Spanish Dual Language program and our STEM program are available to incoming students (includes LEGO Robotics, Coding, and our partnership with Urban Advantage, a premier NYC science organization). Additionally, we offer our students a wide variety of activities in the areas of sports, art, music, drama, and community service in partnership with the Greater Ridgewood Youth Council Beacon Program. We offer leadership programs such as Peer Mediation, Beautiful Me, LGBTQ, and Unleashed.

properties.NAME: P.S. 102 Bayview
properties.OVERVIEW: Whether it's sports, field trips, personalized learning, or curricula rich in reading, writing, and authentic thinking, P.S./I.S. 102Q has all the programs you'd expect from an excellent school. But these programs are not the main reasons why our students achieve. Our students achieve because they understand the greater purpose requiring them to do so: to serve others. Think for yourself; care for others. It's what we do at P.S./I.S. 102.
properties.SUBWAY: M, R to Grand Ave - Newtown

properties.NAME: P.S. 105 The Bay School
properties.OVERVIEW: The mission of P.S./M.S. 105 is to utilize all available resources to prepare all of our students to meet high-quality, challenging standards of excellence. Our positive attitude fosters a climate that motivates both staff and students to perform with enthusiasm! Each day, our students are engaged in learning the Common Core Standards as we prepare them to be college- and career-ready. Our staff and administration work hard to bridge the gap between school, family, and community through field trips, school events, and parent workshops.

properties.NAME: Jean Nuzzi Intermediate School
properties.OVERVIEW: Jean Nuzzi Intermediate School 109 provides an accessible, high-quality, and future-oriented education as well as community service through a variety of academically rigorous classes. We serve the diverse needs of all learners in the ever-changing local, regional, and global economy. In an atmosphere of free inquiry and technological innovation, we deliver quality instruction, programs, and activities that give students transferable education and skills, as well as personal social enrichment. When students graduate from Jean Nuzzi Intermediate School 109, they will have had enriching experiences that encourage lifelong learning.

properties.NAME: P.S. 111 Jacob Blackwell
properties.OVERVIEW: Community School 111Q has achieved success on the path to demonstrable improvement. A forerunner in Renewal efforts, we are implementing cutting edge educational programs that are supporting our scholars, parents, teachers, staff members, and the community. Our scholars engage in discussions with their peers and staff as they study academic and social theories and writing in all of the core subjects. We have implemented the Teacher's College Writing Curriculum, evaluative portfolios in core subject areas, the use of daily formative assessments to monitor progress, independent reading, myON, and Mathletics computer-based interventions and a balanced approach to literacy, science, social studies, and math instruction.

properties.NAME: P.S./I.S. 113 Anthony J. Pranzo
properties.OVERVIEW: P.S./I.S. 113Q is a K-8 school that focuses on strong academics and discipline. Teachers in all grades have high expectations for their students and, with appropriate scaffolding and support, help students to unlock their potential.

properties.NAME: P.S./M.S. 114 Belle Harbor
properties.OVERVIEW: P.S./M.S. 114 is a K-8 neighborhood school in the Belle Harbor section of Queens. We provide a nurturing environment in a familiar setting for our middle school students. Eighth grade students are offered the opportunity to graduate with Regents credits in Living Environment and Algebra. All middle school students have one Advisory period per week where groups of students work on building social emotional skills. In addition, our students are able to partake in the following extra-curricular activities before, during, and after school: National Junior Honors Society, foreign language (Spanish), concert/marching/jazz bands, journalism club, College Access for All, art club, curriculum-related trips, senior trip, and Millennium after-school program.

properties.NAME: P.S./I.S. 116 William C. Hughley
properties.OVERVIEW: We believe in providing a nurturing learning environment where students benefit from an academically rigorous curriculum rich in the arts, science, and social studies, as well as ELA and math. Students are presented with clear objectives for learning, rigorous tasks, and opportunities to engage in accountable talk on a daily basis. We build our students' character by infusing service learning into our lessons. They will participate in school and community projects that are meaningful. By laying a foundation across content areas and infusing the arts and character-building into the curriculum, our goal is to prepare every scholar at our school to enter and graduate from a four-year college or university. We are truly committed to the following: student responsibility, teacher accountability, academic achievement, nurturing environment, dedication to strengthening the home-school connection, aspiring to succeed, respect for all, development of community relations, and social awareness.

properties.NAME: P.S./I.S. 119 The Glendale
properties.OVERVIEW: Parents and students value our focus on providing opportunities for students to become lifelong learners. Parents also appreciate that our challenging curricula prepare their children to become college- and career-ready. Our programs include performing arts, accelerated courses, and foreign languages.

properties.NAME: P.S. 122 Mamie Fay
properties.OVERVIEW: Our Academy for the Intellectually Gifted at P.S. 122 is a district-wide Gifted and Talented program with a rich history. Our program design aims to maximize the degree of academic acceleration while providing a diverse array of enrichment opportunities and an emphasis on the physical, social, and emotional well-being of the exceptional students who are admitted to our school. We are committed to the goal of creating lifelong learners by providing a stimulating academic environment centered on students' interests. Academic content work incorporates many opportunities to engage in problem-based learning (PBL), challenging and creative projects, and teacher assessments, as well as self or peer assessments. Students are well prepared for academic requirements of New York City's specialized high schools. At "The Academy," we welcome the constructive participation of all stakeholders. We recognize that vibrant home/school/community partnerships increase the chances of maximizing our students' potential.
properties.SUBWAY: N, Q to Astoria - Ditmars Blvd

properties.NAME: P.S. 124 Osmond A Church
properties.OVERVIEW: P.S./M.S. 124 strives to give every student the opportunity to be engaged in their learning through a rigorous curriculum that is aligned to the Common Core Learning Standards. Instruction is differentiated to meet the diverse needs of every student. Students are provided with rich learning experiences inside and outside of school, which allows them to compete globally.

properties.NAME: I.S. 125 Thom J. McCann Woodside
properties.OVERVIEW: I.S. 125 is a well-developed school that provides instruction to a very diverse population of students from over 60 countries. Though a large school, we provide a safe, welcoming, and nurturing environment through our small learning communities. Students are divided into four houses with a dedicated assistant principal, guidance counselor, and dean. I.S. 125 offers an extensive arts program. Day and evening performances are offered throughout the school year. I.S. 125 has a unique accelerated program which provides the opportunity for gifted students to sit for Regents exams. Students graduate from I.S. 125 fully prepared for high school and, by extension, college and their career. Parents are an integral part of the I.S. 125 community. They are valued members of the School Leadership Team, PTA, and various other committees. We hold evening events, including a multicultural show and dinner.

properties.NAME: Albert Shanker School for Visual and Performing Ar
properties.OVERVIEW: I.S. 126 is committed to providing a safe learning environment where all students are held accountable to reach high levels of academic achievement. We challenge our students with a rigorous curriculum and college-readiness expectations. In addition to Regents classes, we offer preparatory classes for the Specialized High School Admissions Test (SHSAT) and the NYS State exams. I.S. 126 has a partnership with City Year, who assist our students in developing their academic and leadership skills. We enrich our students through arts residencies with our partners. We have a science lab and computer labs that are state-of-the-art. These programs allow us to extend the academic rigor in the classrooms. I.S. 126 believes parents are equal partners in their children's education. We foster an open-door policy, where parents are encouraged to communicate and build successful relationships with school leaders. We offer BUS service for eligible sixth graders. We also have arts residencies with Community Word Project and Alvin Ailey.

properties.NAME: P.S. 127 Aerospace Science Magnet School
properties.OVERVIEW: At P.S./I.S. 127 we will work collaboratively to promote the social and emotional growth of all students and cultivate self-motivated lifelong learners who are college and career ready. Our shared vision is to inspire students to pursue their dreams by fostering a safe, trusting, and nurturing environment that will promote academic, social, and emotional growth of all scholars at P.S./I.S. 127Q. Our school offers three different program choices for English Language Learners (ELL). We have a K-8 dual language program. Students entering the dual language program in the 6th grade are given a baseline assessment in order for our school to provide the best services to ELLs.

properties.NAME: P.S. 128 The Lorraine Tuzzo, Juniper Valley Elemen
properties.OVERVIEW: Our mission is to enable each student to attain his or her highest potential and prepare students to become successful and productive members of society. We firmly believe that all students have the ability to attain significant progress through a school-wide culture of learning. We challenge all students through a rigorous academic environment which promotes college- and career-readiness.
properties.SUBWAY: M to Middle Village - Metropolitan Ave

properties.NAME: M.S. 137 America's School of Heroes
properties.OVERVIEW: M.S. 137 America's School of Heroes is a large, diverse, urban middle school in Ozone Park, Queens. It is made up of professionals dedicated to providing every student with the support to grow emotionally, intellectually, and socially into a contributing member of society. We are committed to instilling the importance of education and lifelong learning, as well as college and career readiness. M.S. 137 provides its staff with professional learning that supports continued growth and best practices that promote student progress. We offer specialized classes, Regents classes, a Spanish Dual Language program and academic intervention support services. Our recently updated Library Media Center is filled with resources, and our librarian collaborates with students and staff on a variety of projects and initiatives. In addition, we have recently implemented an iPad Initiative, in which we aim to provide all students with 1:1 devices in the coming years. We continue to refine our curriculum to meet the goals of the Common Core Learning Standards, 21st century skills and the College and Career Readiness framework. We recognize the importance of collaboration between all members of our school community as a means of ensuring success!

properties.NAME: P.S./M.S. 138 Sunrise
properties.OVERVIEW: Our Mission: The Sunrise School P.S./M.S. 138 provides students with the opportunity to become independent thinkers in a risk-free environment. We ensure that all students have access to the latest and greatest academic opportunities while making certain they have support along the way. Additionally, we work hard to expose our students to all of the cultural specialties our city has to offer. Our Vision: Creating LEADERS....one Sunrise at a time!

properties.NAME: I.S. 141 The Steinway
properties.OVERVIEW: Nestled in the heart of Astoria, I.S. 141, which ranks top 20% for the past 10 years, provides rigorous academic instruction in a caring and supportive learning environment. Our focus is to challenge our students to excel in their academics, to foster critical thinking and intellectual curiosity, and to ensure that our students acquire the skills necessary to excel in high school, college, and beyond. A "Respect for All" school, 141 offers a strong Honors program, which provides in-depth study and prepares students for Regents exams in Living Environment and Algebra I, while also promoting the arts and humanities, by offering dance, music, and two art courses. This year, 30 students were accepted into NYC's Specialized High Schools and 34 were accepted into Townsend Harris, Bard, Frank Sinatra, Beacon, Baccalaureate, Manhattan/Hunter Science High School, High School of Fashion Industries, and Talent Unlimited. Our parent coordinator offers biweekly parent workshops addressing such topics as transitioning to middle school, high school admission process, SHSAT, and adolescent development of middle school students. Most importantly, IS 141 fosters an open door policy for all parents and guardians.
properties.SUBWAY: N, Q to Astoria - Ditmars Blvd

properties.NAME: I.S. 145 Joseph Pulitzer
properties.OVERVIEW: We offer five themed academies: Math & Business, Science & Technology, Journalism & Media Arts, Law & Humanities, and International. Our educational mission is to create a community of active learners, enabling our students to reach their full intellectual potential in developing 21st century skills. We also offer an excellent dual language program as well as bilingual and English as a New Language classes.

properties.NAME: P.S. 146 Howard Beach
properties.OVERVIEW: The Howard Beach School is a student-friendly neighborhood school that prides itself on providing a safe and nurturing learning environment for all students. We strive to improve the quality of each student's writing across all content areas, resulting in strategic thinking and effective communication. We value the social, emotional, and academic growth of all students in order to prepare them to be high school-, college-, and career-ready.
properties.SUBWAY: A to Howard Beach - JFK Airport

properties.NAME: P.S./M.S. 147 Ronald McNair
properties.OVERVIEW: The staff of The Ronald McNair School is committed to providing a rigorous academic program within an environment that offers social emotional support that will enable students to meet or exceed Common Core Learning Standards. We deliver quality instruction, the arts, enrichment clubs and leadership programs for our students. Our goal is to help students develop into critical thinkers, lifelong learners and productive citizens to the world at large.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 157 Stephen A. Halsey
properties.OVERVIEW: Students enjoy being part of a school that provides a nurturing environment which celebrates their work and achievement and offers a variety of enrichment activities. Students in our accelerated Honors Program take NYC High School Courses and Regents (Algebra 1;Biology; US History). Students also enjoy participating in the Performing Arts Talent Program of their choice, including theatrical productions in Drama, Choral, Band, STEAM, Tech/Computers, Dance and Visual Arts. Students participate in the New York State School Music Association festival and other performance and competitive based activities. Parents like how our school promotes a child-centered learning environment. We promote parent engagement and an open door policy where parents can come to our school at any time and speak to a member of our staff. We collaborate with parents and guardians to ensure their child's success at J.H.S 157.

properties.NAME: M.S. 158 Marie Curie
properties.OVERVIEW: We provide challenging instruction in a nurturing environment. Our teachers address the Common Core Learning Standards (CCLS) by infusing technology into our curriculum so that students achieve their potential and are ready to enter college. We have a state-of-the-art computer lab and each class has access to SMART Boards and iPads. Students have opportunities to showcase their literary and artistic talents. We use SchoolMessenger, email, and an online grading system to keep parents informed of their child's progress. We offer after-school programs daily through our partnership with the Samuel Field Y Beacon Program. Through our partnerships, students are provided experiences and enrichment to develop their learning. Our Technology and Fine Arts Department receives many grants. Per an average compiled by the Wall Street Journal, M.S. 158 sends more students to Specialized High Schools than any other middle school in Queens.

properties.NAME: P.S. 164 Queens Valley
properties.OVERVIEW: A dedicated staff and small school environment offer individualized social, emotional, and academic support. Queens Valley School offers all students high quality, instruction to prepare them for high school as well as college and/or a career. We value our technology program which includes SMART Boards, Promethean Boards, lap tops, desk tops and a state of the art lab. We offer an accelerated Regents program to all eligible eighth grade students. Our web-based programs include Castle Learning, Ed Performance, GoMath, Code X, Kahoot and Quizlet. Our Talent program provides students with an innovative and in-depth study in visual arts, dance, drama, vocal music, and video production. In addition, we have added a Talent track in coding and publishing; this provides our students with an opportunity to develop skills in STEM, computer programming, and graphic design. It is a vibrant program that strives to encourage and facilitate an enriched and creative environment. Our teachers model their artistic process with commitment to scaffold instruction. We have had students place as both finalists and semifinalists in the P.S. Art city-wide competition since its inception 10 years ago.
properties.BUS: Q20A, Q20B, Q44-SBS, Q46, QM1, QM31, QM35, QM36, QM5, QM6, QM7, QM8

properties.NAME: Metropolitan Expeditionary Learning School
properties.OVERVIEW: We follow the EL Education (eleducation.org) model, in which students engage in learning expeditions and have multiple opportunities for hands-on learning. Students participate in fieldwork experiences with experts in a variety of fields (activists, authors, scientists, doctors, etc.) that take them outside of the classroom and give them a chance to experience the concepts they are learning. Students receive a strong background in science, technology, and sustainability and have multiple opportunities after school to apply the ideas learned in class to real-world projects. Parents play a major role in the school, from attending student-led conferences to being chaperones and participants for fieldwork to contributing to various school committees. Students belong to crews, which are small advisory groups with an advisor. Students participate in a four-day wilderness/backpacking adventure.

properties.NAME: Irwin Altman Middle School 172
properties.OVERVIEW: Irwin Altman MS 172 combines a rigorous curriculum, a dedicated and experienced staff, and a student-oriented philosophy to achieve our goal of academic excellence for all students. We are acutely aware of our students' unique social and emotional needs as they transition from their elementary schools into the more challenging rigors of preparing for college and career readiness in the sixth, seventh and eighth grades. We believe that students learn best through authentic and rigorous intellectual engagement aligned to the Common Core Learning Standards. Emphasis is placed on in-depth academic exploration that results in high quality discussion and writing that demonstrates deep and elaborate thinking in all content areas. MS 172 was recognized in the NYCDOE Annual Arts Report for our dedication to Arts Education including visual and performance arts. At 172, we provide parents with ongoing contact and school information through our school website, MS172.org and through PupilPath, emails, and phone messages. In collaboration with our PTA, we promote parent engagement through informational presentations and both child and parent-centered activities that fulfill our mission of our school being the educational center of our community.

properties.NAME: P.S. Q177
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: P.S./ IS 178 Holliswood
properties.OVERVIEW: All children can exceed standards by being part of a nurturing environment that challenges them to reach their fullest potential. At P.S./I.S. 178, we promote an environment that encourages communication, collaboration, and inclusion where every community member is an active participant in the contributions of the school's success. We create a haven where students are empowered and recognized for their unique abilities. Our school's core values are deeply rooted in 4E's: Equity, Empathy, Excellence, & Experiential Learning. All members of our school community are guided by these core values and are committed to creating learning experiences every day that embody this. We are an all-inclusive school where staff members, parents, guardians, and students find the family environment which they are a part of to be remarkable. Differentiated instruction and acceleration take place across all classes from pre-kindergarten through eighth grade on a daily basis. There is a plethora of after school programs to choose from as we are proponents of enrichment, sports, and the arts. We believe that every child has a gift and it is our shared responsibility as educators to identify what that is and tap into it to develop other skills.

properties.NAME: P.S. 183 Dr. Richard R. Green
properties.OVERVIEW: We are committed to providing an enriched and rigorous education to all students in a nurturing and supportive environment. We utilize individual student data to tailor instruction and create targeted intervention to meet the needs of all students.
properties.SUBWAY: S to Beach 90th St-Holland; A to Beach 67th St-Gaston

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 185 Edward Bleeker
properties.OVERVIEW: We ensure our students are prepared for college and 21st Century careers. Our teachers provide support and enrichment in an inquiry-based environment. We incorporate STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Math) into the curriculum through our Collaborative Learning Program and Software Engineering Pilot. Students experience an interdisciplinary approach to learning through residency programs with Arts Connection, Silk Road Connect, and other cultural partners. Our students participate in engaging field trips, artist visits, and performances, and have won awards in science, math, robotics, art, spelling, and athletic competitions. We partner with Asia Society and Confucius Classrooms to provide our students with cultural experiences, and we offer Chinese language instruction and a dual language program. Parents are integral to our school community and they are invited to participate in activities and take on leadership roles. Daily communication between parents and our school is facilitated via our interactive website and Pupil Path online system.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 189 Daniel Carter Beard
properties.OVERVIEW: J.H.S. 189 provides opportunities for young people to be engaged in social action/community service projects. In this context, students identify problems as well as needs and seek solutions that make a difference. To that end, every person at J.H.S. 189 is involved in a year-long community service project. Giving back to the community is a core belief in our school's culture. As a result, we have approximately 42 social action projects every year.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 190 Russell Sage
properties.OVERVIEW: Students like our diverse, collaborative school community dedicated to achieving academic excellence for all students. Our nurturing environment fosters a family of lifelong learners. We pride ourselves on delivering challenging and engaging lessons as well as offering a multitude of activities to develop a well-rounded child. We offer Regents courses, Multiple Foreign Language courses, a full talent program which includes fine arts, band, chorus, dance, and drama courses. Students as well as parents appreciate the extra help and support available. We embrace our multicultural student body where we have a 100% respect for 100% of people, 100% of the time philosophy. All students from sixth, seventh, and eighth grade are encouraged to participate in Student Council because it provides them the opportunity to get involved. In addition, students have the opportunity to be inducted into the National Junior Honor Society (NJHS) and participate in the Mathcounts Competition. We have a state-of-the-art science lab, a newly renovated student-friendly library, two computer labs, multiple computer carts, and a brand new fully-furnished dance studio. We have an active Parent Association whose members work tirelessly for the good of our school.
properties.SUBWAY: M, R to 67th Ave; E, F to Forest Hills - 71st Ave

properties.NAME: I.S. 192 The Linden
properties.OVERVIEW: The Linden-Renaissance Middle School (I.S. 192 The Linden) offers a variety of learning opportunities through a STEM focus. We are the designated District STEM School, and the leading technology school in the district for the last five years. We are the only district school to offer a Robotics Program, and have a current Championship Team. We teach 21st century skills using 21st century tools such as: Apple iPads, the Apple Mac Lab, and interactive whiteboards throughout classrooms. In addition, our newest additions include a state of the art recording studio, fitness center, and our dance studio. We offer an Early High School Program where our students have the opportunity to acquire high school and Regents credits by the end of eighth grade. In addition to our various academic focuses, we also offer a variety of both competitive, and non-competitive athletic programs. We offer extensive after-school and Saturday programs. Our parents participate in a variety of programs and activities throughout the year.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 194 William Carr
properties.OVERVIEW: J.H.S. 194 aims to educate children holistically by challenging all students academically, encouraging student voice, and supporting self-expression through a diverse fine and performing arts department, which includes: fine art, concert band, theater, film and media, dance, chorus and photography. J.H.S. 194 strives to support students academically, socially, and emotionally through our grade-level academies, each with a dean, an assistant principal, and two shared guidance counselors. We house a Beacon program on-site which expands the choice of after-school activities for students. Our fine and performing arts department collaborates with numerous arts agencies throughout the city, including: New York City Center, Flushing Town Hall, Jazz from Lincoln Center, and Magic Box. We have student council in every grade and encourage students to be active members in the planning of school events. We believe parental involvement is essential to student success. We welcome open communication with our families and host a variety of events throughout the year.

properties.NAME: P.S./M.S. 200 - The Magnet School of Global Studie
properties.OVERVIEW: We are now The Magnet School of Global Studies & Leadership. Our students study different nations and cultures and they even connect with world travelers through Skype. They explore ways in which they can become leaders and effect global change. We are a one-to-one technology school; all students have their own Chromebook. Our rigorous curriculum emphasizes the use of STEM principles to make the world a better place. We are a unique school because we are small, but we span grades PK-8. Middle school students have the opportunity to act as mentors for younger students in the building. Our motto is: "200 Cares." We strive to build and maintain a caring school environment where all students feel welcome and supported. Middle school students also engage in two semesters of enrichment electives each year, including topics like chess, media studies, yoga, comedic improvisation, journalism, community service, and sign language. In addition to the core academic subjects, we offer Spanish, Visual Arts, Drama, and Physical Education three times per week. We also invite middle school students to participate in a variety of sports such as soccer, basketball, softball, and dance before school and to attend our free, daily after-school program.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 202 Robert H. Goddard
properties.OVERVIEW: Robert H. Goddard 202 is a large, diverse NYC middle school. Our mission is to provide our students with a comprehensive education with an emphasis on the Fine Arts. Our arts program provides instrumental, choral music, visual arts, and drama. Annually our students participate in performances including Carnegie Hall and other festivals. We teach to the 21st century learner. Every classroom is equipped with a Promethean Board and technologies such as iPads and laptops. We offer advanced regents courses in Algebra and Earth Science and classes for students with disabilities and English Language Learners. We present a variety of opportunities to motivate and foster interpersonal relationships. Many programs are available such as garden club, strategic games, mentoring, coding, debate, yoga, scrapbooking, chorus, band, dance, SHST and Regents prep, Korean club, and Beautiful Me. Our debate club students place in the top ten in competitions citywide. Our competitive sports programs include Champs and The Peninsula League for basketball and volleyball. In the past two years our boys basketball team has made it to the Peninsula League finals. We address the whole child to meet the needs of all 21st century learners.

properties.NAME: I.S. 204 Oliver W. Holmes
properties.OVERVIEW: What parents like best about The OWH School: our safe and welcoming environment, our rigorous curricula that prepares students for college and careers, student-led conferences, the dual language, NEST, bilingual and magnet programs, our core values, our open-door policy, frequent communication, small communities to meet the social and emotional needs of all children, Honors and Regents courses, our on-line grade book (PupilPath), Class Dojo, science/STEM research, interdisciplinary projects, awards celebrations, parent workshops, free adult English as a New Language classes, community partnerships, and high expectations for all students and staff members. What students like best about OWH: a feeling of safety, our challenging academic environment, student collaboration and critical thinking, student-led conferences, teachers, student-centered classrooms, updated technology, lunch clubs, STEM, CUNY Arts, Brain Power, Sanford Harmony, Town-Hall, College and Career Days, Harlem Magic Masters Basketball, accessibility to staff, Google Docs, small classes, Greater Ridgewood After-School Beacon Program, school spirit days, free tutoring, and students feeling exceptionally well-prepared for high school, college, and a career.
properties.SUBWAY: N, Q to 36 Ave-Washington Ave; M, R to 36th St; F to 21st St - Queensbridge; E to Queens Plaza

properties.NAME: P.S. 207 Rockwood Park
properties.OVERVIEW: Please contact the school for more information.

properties.NAME: P.S./I.S. 208
properties.OVERVIEW: The mission of P.S./I.S. 208 is to prepare the leaders of tomorrow by building a safe, nested community of learners where every participant is fully engaged in document-based questions, accountable talk, scientific and inquiry-based research strategies, and performance-oriented tasks, as well as creating a nurturing learning environment via sound instructional practices and differentiated learning. Additionally, we will empower children to become self-sufficient and responsible. At P.S./I.S. 208, we create lifelong learners and children who are proficient in science and the arts.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 210 Elizabeth Blackwell
properties.OVERVIEW: Elizabeth Blackwell Middle School 210Q believes that all students in our programs can achieve high standards of excellence within academic areas. We always emphasize the role of both the school and the home in ensuring that our children grow cognitively, creatively, and socially. Our message is to engage all of our students in our programs in active and productive activities. At MS210 we have high expectations for ALL our students. Our core values of creativity, perseverance, citizenship, courage, integrity, responsibility, self-discipline, and teamwork will guide how we interact socially and academically at MS210. We have a Career Academy theme. There are five different career academies: Academy of Graphic Arts and Computer Science, Academy of Visual and Performing Arts, Academy of Health Professions, Academy of Law and Humanities, and Academy of Engineering and Architecture. Within the AGACS, students learn graphic arts and computer technology; within AVPA they learn studio art, theatre, instrumental band, and vocal music; within AHP they learn forensic science and introduction to health professions; within ALH they learn philosophy, criminal justice, and urban law; and within AEA they learn design and modeling and construction.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 216 George J. Ryan
properties.OVERVIEW: We are a diverse community with a student-centered environment promoting mutual respect for all and maximizing students' potential for high school readiness. Chosen as one of only 11 Chancellor's Learning Partners Plus Schools, we received praise for being in the top 1% of NYC middle schools for student progress in 2015 and again in 2017. We received "Well-Developed" in all 10 categories on the 2015 Quality Review. Teachers address the Next Generation Standards in all subject areas and produce exceptional lessons through thematic interdisciplinary learning/teaching. Ryan has three academies (Law & Justice, Media Arts, and Scientific Exploration) that offer the same rich Common Core curriculum with opportunities for additional learning based on academy theme. Each academy offers Honors/SP courses, talent courses, and classrooms infusing technology. Incoming sixth graders all take Robotics and Art talent courses. We are one of only two schools in NYC offering a full year of Robotics instruction for every sixth grader. We are a Software Engineering Program school offering computer programming/coding. Our school also benefits from a partnership with St. John's University. We believe in helping great children become great students.

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 217 Robert A. Van Wyck
properties.OVERVIEW: Students like our technology-based education. They use their laptops in class to take notes via the use of Google Docs, do research, and create iMovies, PowerPoints, class wikis, and class blogs. Through our Green Magnet Educating for Sustainability curriculum, students are involved in studying about, and taking actions in, their local and global communities. Students also like the wide range of in-class programs and after-school activities we offer. Parents appreciate our parent education classes and the school's communication efforts, including many opportunities for parental involvement. We utilize a web-based communication portal called PupilPath that permits parents and students to track student academic and behavior progress daily and in real-time. Laptops and additional digital devices are utilized in all classrooms. Our school community is diverse, with over 40 nations represented. We have a greenhouse, pollinators' garden, and an organic vegetable garden on our campus.
properties.SUBWAY: F to Sutphin Blvd; E to Briarwood - Van Wyck Blvd

properties.NAME: P.S. 219 Paul Klapper
properties.OVERVIEW: We are proud of our school. Teachers, students, and families are dedicated. We practice the concept of social justice, which we translate to mean Equity Access, maximum inclusion for all. This is reflected in how we build our classes, organize all activities, and ensure that every student has access to all the school has to offer. Nearly all of our students take two Regents and our high passing rate reflects high expectations and high achievement for all students. The process starts for many of our students in Pre-K and we welcome new students all along the way to eighth grade graduation! Parents appreciate how our school provides a challenging curriculum within a small learning community that promotes positive behavior. Our collaborative teams work together to set goals, plan for effective instruction, and monitor and assess student performance. The skills and strategies that students gain enable them to attain success and reach their potential. Our skilled staff supports families in many ways. Parents feel that the school creates a physically and emotionally secure environment in which everyone can focus on student learning. A quick visit to the school will reveal the "family feel" most visitors notice when they are here.

properties.NAME: P.S. Q224
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: J.H.S. 226 Virgil I. Grissom
properties.OVERVIEW: J.H.S. 226 focuses on exploratory learning. The school is organized into three learning communities. The Discovery and Explorations Academy is a hub for sixth graders, which allows students opportunities to explore the Junior High School experience through academic rigor, discipline, creativity, and culture. The Humanities Academy showcases the talents of our seventh-grade youngsters with quarterly performances and displays in music, art, dance, poetry, and drama while continuing to engage students in academic rigor around the Common Core Learning Standards. The Renaissance Academy for Broadcast Journalism engages our eighth-grade students in print and digital media. Students utilize elements of print and digital media to develop quarterly displays in a student newspaper, video broadcast, and a student comic magazine, while continuing to engage in academic rigor around the Common Core Learning Standards.

properties.NAME: I.S. 227 Louis Armstrong
properties.OVERVIEW: The Louis Armstrong Middle School (LAMS), opened in 1979 with the mission of bringing together a group of culturally diverse children to help them grow academically, emotionally, physically, and socially. At LAMS, students are provided a personalized, caring, and supportive environment. The staff works to build the childrens' confidence and work ethic in order to develop a sense of pride in their choices, actions, and quality of work. In addition to the core subjects, LAMS offers Accelerated Regents courses, foreign language courses, music courses, art courses, physical and adaptive fitness courses, and technology courses. The school is affiliated with Queens College, Vaughn College, National Middle School Association, and National School Reform Policy. Our school is an original recipient of the U.S. President Award for Excellence, has been recognized four consecutive years as a Reward Status School, and by the NASSP as being, "one of the top 100 most effective middle schools in the U.S." Students receive stop to stop BUSing from any area in Queens.

properties.NAME: I.S. 230
properties.OVERVIEW: Intermediate School 230, The School for Civics in the Community, provides activities that engage, challenge, and stimulate students. Parents appreciate that we are a nurturing school, and as a result we are a very popular school. Our sixth-grade academy is housed in our annex which is located directly across the street from the main building. The main building houses our seventh and eighth grades. The small learning community of the annex provides a very important transition for students entering middle school. Intermediate School 230Q has developed a positive reputation based upon our challenging academic curricula, supportive teachers, and safe environment. Each year, a very limited number of seats are available for students residing outside of our geographical zone in Jackson Heights.
properties.SUBWAY: M, R to 65th St; 7, E, F to Jackson Hts-Roosevelt Ave

properties.NAME: P.S. 232 Lindenwood
properties.OVERVIEW: Please contact the school for more information.

properties.NAME: P.S. Q233
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: Academy for New Americans
properties.OVERVIEW: The Academy for New Americans offers newly arrived immigrant students and their families the opportunity to adjust successfully to their new setting. The program offers a specialized curriculum that facilitates the acquisition of the English language through a one-year programmatic option. Our school is committed to providing the following services to our students: a welcoming climate that is conducive to English language acquisition, a specialized curriculum that focuses on English language proficiency, an environment that promotes self-esteem and addresses the needs of early adolescence, an introduction to the New York City school system, an emphasis on becoming familiar with American culture, computer literacy classes, support services such as counseling and tutoring, and a committed, well-trained staff that guides the students through the transition period as they become acclimated to our multicultural society.

properties.NAME: Academy for New Americans
properties.OVERVIEW: The Academy for New Americans offers newly arrived immigrant students and their families the opportunity to adjust successfully to their new setting. The program offers a specialized curriculum that facilitates the acquisition of the English language through a one-year programmatic option. Our school is committed to providing the following services to our students: a welcoming climate that is conducive to English language acquisition, a specialized curriculum that focuses on English language proficiency, an environment that promotes self-esteem and addresses the needs of early adolescence, an introduction to the New York City school system, an emphasis on becoming familiar with American culture, computer literacy classes, support services such as counseling and tutoring, and a committed, well-trained staff that guides the students through the transition period as they become acclimated to our multicultural society.

properties.NAME: I.S. 237
properties.OVERVIEW: I.S. 237 provides a roBUSt and supportive middle school experience and, at the same time, promotes college and career readiness in multiple ways. Our strong academic program includes Special Progress (SP) courses on each grade level. Eighth grade SP students take Regents exams in Algebra, US History & Government, Earth Science, and Living Environment, as well as the Spanish Proficiency exam. Many students go on to attend Stuyvesant, Bronx Science, and Brooklyn Tech. English language learners receive instruction before, after, and during the school day as well as on Saturdays. All students receive instruction in visual arts, band, strings, or chorus. Our extended day programs include academic tutoring, basketball, musical theater, guitar, keyboard, and art. Our Debate and Math teams have won multiple district-, borough-, and city-wide tournaments. SONYC, a free after-school program, offers homework help and recreational activities Monday through Friday from 2:20pm-5pm, Monday and Wednesday evenings from 5pm-6:30pm, and is open during most school holidays. We welcome parent involvement at all times.

properties.NAME: I.S. 238 - Susan B. Anthony Academy
properties.OVERVIEW: I.S. 238 "The Susan B. Anthony Academy" offers students of all abilities and learning styles the opportunity to succeed in a climate of respect for all members of the school community. All eighth-grade students take Integrated Algebra I Regents and Living Environment Regents. We are part of the Middle School Quality Initiative (MSQI) and the Art as Text Partnership through Lincoln Center. Our teachers frequently attend professional development sessions focused on student engagement and collaboration. Almost every classroom has interactive SMART Board technology, Promethean Flat Panel Systems, and we also have SMART Board Presentation Systems, wireless computer carts, and iPad carts. Additionally, we have an Apple iMac lab, graphic arts courses, chorus courses, and dance courses. We value our students and make their educational needs our priority.

properties.NAME: I.S. 250 The Robert F. Kennedy Community Middle Sc
properties.OVERVIEW: I.S. 250 is a small learning environment which promotes lifelong learners who possess strong character, self-worth, and the tools needed to be productive citizens. Students will acquire the knowledge and skills to be college- and career-ready through a rigorous curriculum that addresses our diverse learners. All students are empowered to be confident, tolerant, and empathetic to their community while flourishing in a school that celebrates multi-culturalism, acceptance, and individuality. Our mission is to build a solid foundation focusing on social responsibility, hope for the future, and lifelong success, NO EXCEPTIONS!

properties.NAME: Queens School of Inquiry, The
properties.OVERVIEW: Students like the warm-yet-demanding teachers who challenge and engage them. They profit from their early exposure to the campus, courses, and professors at Queens College and find a wide variety of friends here. The Queens School of Inquiry (QSI) is a neighborhood school that works with Queens College (QC) beginning in the sixth grade so that students may earn up to 60 free QC credits in high school. Parents appreciate the personal contact with their child's teachers and with the principal.

properties.NAME: P.S. Q255
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: Pathways College Preparatory School: A College Boa
properties.OVERVIEW: Pathways College Preparatory School (PCPS) is a community that educates the mind, body, and soul of each of our students in preparation for entrance into and success in college. We view college opportunity and success as a pathway to excellence and equity in life. Through our partnerships with families, community organizations, and universities, we seek out real-world learning experiences for students to enhance their skills and knowledge. As a result, graduates from PCPS will be able to use their experiences to think critically about personal, political, and professional responsibility and the impact of their choices on their lives, community, and the world at large.

properties.NAME: Channel View School for Research
properties.OVERVIEW: Channel View School for Research (CVSR) is an Expeditionary Learning School that believes students learn best through a project-based approach. Students focus on character and career development by participating in small advisory groups called Crew. Our students are researchers, historians, urban planners, and scientists that investigate real world problems and develop creative, actionable solutions using cutting-edge technology. We have a Research Technology Robotics program and an oceanography program that uses technology that allows students to actively explore the aquatic ecology beneath Jamaica Bay and the Atlantic Ocean. Our program is highly engaging and pushes students to do their best while developing a culture of collaboration and teamwork.

properties.NAME: P.S./I.S. 266
properties.OVERVIEW: Located on the beautiful, Frank Padavan Campus, PS/IS 266Q is a barrier-free building exemplifying excellence through student-driven learning experiences. Students take ownership of their learning and make connections to the real world, while thriving in a nurturing environment that celebrates the individuality and diversity of all learners. In grade eight, a range of advanced courses is offered. Our belief in the value of growth mindset has a direct positive impact on student achievement. Faculty, parents, and students collaborate to meet the academic needs of our students in appropriately-rigorous ways, while also fostering students' social, emotional, and physical growth. PS/IS 266Q offers a variety of clubs, teams, performing arts and physical activities both during and after school hours, such as chess, debate, choir, drama, and track. Throughout the year, a multitude of activities reflect the diversity represented within our school community, culminating with our festive Multicultural Day. This encourages students to respect others, and to also appreciate their community and themselves. Finally, character development programs such as Beautiful Me and Real Heroes prepare students for life beyond the walls of our school.

properties.NAME: P.S./I.S. 268
properties.OVERVIEW: P.S./I.S. 268 exemplifies a respectful, cooperative, and nurturing environment. Our mission is to create self-motivated, caring, and successful citizens by fostering independence and resourcefulness. Learners achieve academic success by collaborating, sharing values, displaying a zest for increasing their knowledge, and showing integrity and respect. We offer comprehensive programs in art, dance, and music in all grades. Students in grade six are exposed to each art form. In grades seven and eight, students have an opportunity to focus in one of the arts. This allows students to develop their talent, build their portfolio, and prepare for auditions. We are partnered with Urban Advantage and engage students in STEAM activities in our science lab. We collaborate with several cultural institutions which support our teachers, students, and families in preparing for future careers. The school also boasts a state-of-the-art library as well as SMART Boards in every classroom. We offer support for students who are aspiring to gain high school credits and/or attend specialized high schools. We offer NYC Second Language Proficiency Exam in Chinese. Over 90% of our students pass the New York State Common Core Algebra Regents.

properties.NAME: The Gordon Parks School
properties.OVERVIEW: The diverse P.S./I.S. 270 community is dedicated to achieving high standards of academic excellence for all students in a nurturing environment in preparation for the ever-changing challenges of society's new millennium. We want to create a community of lifelong learners whose focus will include the development of attitudinal, civil, and social skills necessary to function productively and successfully on every level, including leadership roles in the world community.

properties.NAME: The Riverview School
properties.OVERVIEW: N/A

properties.NAME: East-West School of International Studies
properties.OVERVIEW: We focus on college and careers from grade 6. We are a small, inclusive school supporting all students through cotaught classes, many with 1:13 class ratios, allowing significant individual support. Students take three additional periods of Math and ELA per week to support high achievement and college readiness. Students take Japanese, Korean, and Chinese. Our school culture embraces our four pillars: honor, excellence, curiosity, and celebration. We pride ourselves on a positive, safe school environment through our anti-bullying program, Rachel's Challenge, advisory, school clubs, and student government. Our parent coordinator and on-site translators keep parents informed through a newsletter, calendar, and monthly First Fridays (parents are invited into EWSIS classes for the day). Assignments, grades, and attendance are available on Pupilpath. Our college focused 6-12 program has 100% of middle school students taking Regents classes, college trips starting in 6th grade, and a dedicated CBI college counselor who helps 100% of our students get accepted to college. We were a Reward School in 2015-16 and a Respect for All School in 2017-18. It is expected that students come to EWSIS for a 7-year program, 6th through 12th grade.

properties.NAME: Knowledge and Power Preparatory Academy VI
properties.OVERVIEW: Knowledge and Power Preparatory Academy VI (KAPPA VI) is located in the beautiful Far Rockaway campus. The school is modeled after the Air Force philosophy of leadership training. Students, who are called cadets, wear a formal uniform and each class, called a squadron, is named after a NASA space mission. Our school's aim is to be an "Ivy League Middle School Academy," with a long-term goal of preparing students for college. The debate team competes in the citywide competition. Math is a point of pride at KAPPA VI, and the school's math team competes in citywide math competitions. Our students are encouraged to take the Specialized High School Admissions Test (SHSAT). KAPPA VI also offers a wide range of enrichment courses, including art and music. We have a state-of-the-art media room with iMac computers, and a state-of-the-art library is being built.

properties.NAME: Preparatory Academy for Writers: A College Board S
properties.OVERVIEW: The Preparatory Academy for Writers is a grade 6-12 school that offers accelerated curricula and ensures that all middle school students take at least two high school Regents exam. Students at Writers often have three Regents exams and six high school credits before they start 9th grade. Students who attend Writers for middle school are given priority when applying to Writers for high school.

properties.NAME: York Early College Academy
properties.OVERVIEW: Vision: The Vision of York Early College Academy (YECA) is to develop the next generation of forward-thinking, tenacious leaders who are socially responsive to their communities. Mission: The mission of York Early College Academy (YECA) is to provide a highly supportive and academically challenging learning environment for traditionally under-served, but strongly motivated students with high potential for future academic and career success. Upon entering sixth grade, college and career preparation is introduced and continually communicated to all students while progressing through a rigorous curricula and instruction centered on critical thinking, research, communication, professional writing, and problem-solving. Our mission will be actualized in an environment where trust is cultivated amongst students, teachers, administrators, staff, parents, and the community. Core Values: Service, Perseverance, Advocacy, Reflection, and Collaboration.

properties.NAME: World Journalism Preparatory: A College Board Scho
properties.OVERVIEW: World Journalism Preparatory School (WJPS) is a place where students feel known, heard, and supported. Our students like the opportunities we present for self-directed learning and enjoy being active participants in a school culture they help build. They also enjoy using technology across the curriculum. Parents value our project-based learning activities and our advisory classes that build relationships with students and teachers. They also appreciate that our seven-year curriculum carries students through a challenging, yet personalized, middle and high school program. Each student creates an online portfolio of their best academic work and they participate in student-led Portfolio Review Conferences. All students have a WJPS email account and a locker. A roBUSt school website, newspaper, broadcast program, online communications system (PupilPath) and other tools means that students and families are always in touch, and aware of school activities. The WJPS motto is "Don't stop until you're proud," and this is evident in our 97% high school graduation rate. It is expected that middle school students come to WJPS for a seven-year program (grades 6-12) that allows them to seamlessly transition to high school.

properties.NAME: Young Women's Leadership School, Astoria
properties.OVERVIEW: The Young Women's Leadership Schools (TYWLS) were established to nurture the intellectual curiosity and creativity of young women by supporting the whole girl in order to maximize academic achievement, social emotional well-being, and post-secondary success. TYWLS of Astoria is supported by The Young Women's Leadership Network (YWLN) and its College Bound Initiative in order to replicate the best practices of private and independent girls' schools. The school approaches learning in a dynamic, participatory fashion, encouraging students to take responsibility for their own learning.
